docs.lead_paragraph: I.B.M. has designed a new operations center for the city of Rio de Janeiro, coordinating all kinds of functions under one roof. The company hopes the project will lead to a huge worldwide business.

headline.seo: I.B.M. Takes ‘Smarter Cities’ Concept to Rio de Janeiro

docs.abstract: International Business Machines has designed a new operations center for Rio de Janeiro, integrating data from about 30 agencies under one roof; company hopes the project will lead to a huge worldwide business, raising its annual revenue to $150 billion or more, from $107 billion in 2011; market to supply cities with 'smart' systems is expected to reach $57 billion by 2014.
docs.snippet: I.B.M. has designed a new operations center for the city of Rio de Janeiro, coordinating all kinds of functions under one roof. The company hopes the project will lead to a huge worldwide business.

docs.lead_paragraph: In an about-face, the conservative talk radio host Rush Limbaugh said Saturday that he was sorry for denouncing as a ''prostitute'' a Georgetown University law student who had spoken publicly in favor of the Obama administration's birth control policy. On Saturday, a day after President Obama telephoned the student, Sandra Fluke, to say he stood by her in the face of personal attacks on right-wing radio, Mr. Limbaugh published the apology on his Web site.

headline.main: Facing Outcry, Limbaugh Apologizes for Attacking Student Over Birth Control

docs.abstract: Radio talk show radio host Rush Limbaugh apologizes for remarks he made about Georgetown University law student Sandra Fluke, who spoke publicly in favor of the Obama administration's policy on contraception coverage; some of Limbaugh's advertisers begin pulling their ads from his show. (M)t

docs.lead_paragraph: That's because they need to prepare multiple sets of tax returns: each partner needs to file a separate federal tax return since the federal government defines marriage as between a man and a woman (though some couples refuse to comply, but that's another story). So same-sex couples also need to prepare a dummy tax return as if they were filing jointly so that they can transfer that information onto their state returns, which they must file as a couple. The situation becomes ridiculously more complex for gay couples living in the three states that have both community property laws and recognize same-sex unions. In that case, officially partnered gay couples need to follow their state's community property laws on their federal returns -- even though they need to file separately.
docs.abstract: Bucks blog discusses the complexities faced by newly-recognized same-sex couples during tax season; regulations require that they must file both as a couple and as individuals, because the federal government defines marriage as between a man and a woman. (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: 8:50 p.m. | Updated WASHINGTON - The election-year fight over the administration's birth control policy escalated Friday, with two unlikely figures - a Georgetown University law student and the conservative radio host Rush Limbaugh - taking center stage in the politically charged conflict and pulling much of official Washington into the fray. On Friday, one day after Senate Democrats beat back a Republican challenge to the new policy, President Obama called Sandra Fluke, the Georgetown student who had come under incendiary attack from Mr. Limbaugh, to thank her for publicly backing his regulations mandating contraception coverage.

headline.main: Obama Backs Student in Birth Control Furor

docs.abstract: Pres Obama calls Sandra Fluke, Georgetown student who has come under incendiary attack from Rush Limbaugh, to thank her for publicly backing regulations mandating contraception coverage; Fluke, an activist on the issue who had previously been barred by Republicans from testifying at a House hearing, provided new fuel to a dispute that has already spilled over into Congress and onto the campaign trail. Photo (M)

headline.main: Attack by Limbaugh Awakens a 'Stop Rush' Campaign
